column4: hello, I have a video in an iso image, how can i see it on my pc?
The standard archive viewer can open and extract .iso files, is the ISO file an image of a DVD?
yes, I managed to mount it but it appears empty
it is a dvd
VLC is the easiest because you can just click "Media" "Play Disc" and change /dev/dvd to the folder where the ISO is mounted.
ok, i'll try that, thanks!
np
didn't work
got an error message that just says it can't open it
Unmount the image,and try re-mounting it, if you used the built-in Ubuntu image mounter, it probably gave you this really weird, cryptic mount location that VLC sometimes doesn't like.
You can make a custom mount point with: sudo mkdir /mnt/iso
ok, i'll try that
Then mount the image with: mount -o loop -t iso9660 FOO.iso /mnt/test
just replace FOO.iso with the actual name of the iso
Oh and stick sudo in front of the mount command, you gotta be root to mount stuff.
i did it, i have the new directory but again it appears empty
Was the DVD an encrypted DVD, like one you bought from Wal-Mart?  If so, do you have libdvdcss2 installed?
i dont know, i downloaded it
Ah, then the image may be corrupted or bad.  You could try re-downloading it, or making an image of one of your own DVDs and mounting that just to make sure your method is working.
ok, thanks a lot for your help
Np
